review: dont know why the reviews are so bad about this game ive played frostpunk 1 many hours and really loved it this frostpunk 2 has indeed a different feeling but you shouldnt compare them the grapics audio and gameplay is really good i have to admit that the game is not easy to play its very demanding but thats the nature of this game anyway for me is perfect

best way to play is not to touch the speed modifier you get more lore and control of problems as you progress through the game highly recommend for the average city builder looking into apocolyptic scenarios
great

this is not a frostpunk game but i still find it pretty fun and addicting if you come into this game only wanting a game that has the same mechanics and feel as the first game you wont get that from frostpunk 2
amazing game however i would recommend playing on the hardest or second hardest difficulty itll help keep the pressure on you the entire game which is where frostpunk shines
gg
its just not frostpunk its a ok game but i feel that its missing something
good game
the gift that keeps on giving fp 2 though initially overwhelming  really builds up pace and fun once you get the hang of it loved it

its a bit less intuitive than the previous game but if you give it a chance and learn its pretty cool dont try the higher difficulties you will fail  game devs should add tutorial quests to make it easier for people to learn
very different from frostpunk 1 has optimization issues much steeper learning curve beware  still it has a lot of good moments

this is fucking peak truly the perfect sequel to frostpunk i am so thankful i have experienced this game thank you 11 but studios and all that worked on this game it truly means a lot to me  peak gameplay very hard

for the love of god please give us free camera so we can admire our metropolis through sun or blizzard  this is a fantastic survival city builder the only reason i can think it doesnt have great reviews is because fans of frostpunk  itself a masterpiece  wanted an expansion of that game whereas this is its own thing if it had a different title its probably be sitting on very positive reviews although this is a great successor to the world set out in the first game
i love these games the dark souls of city building very enjoyable just make sure you clear your schedule first
grim atmosphere always on edge great new mechanics definitely recommended

great successor to frostpunk stunning graphics and amazing music makes it a game you can get lost in quickly

enjoyed frostpunk 1 frostpunk 2 is a downgrade but still enjoyable if a bit generic none of that matters because since i reinstalled the game a a while back it just keeps crashing before i can even load a save followed all the instructions on the faq page but the problem persists so until they fix this broken mess its just a digital paper weight
truly a beautiful game a bit challenging at first but once you get used to it time just flies

you had one of the most unique games with frostpunk 1 and you decided to make a normal city builder even though a very good one also ditched your engine for ue which gave us many technical problems i just dont understand it what a pitty
i really enjoyed the first one but the second one throws so much stuff at you that you have the impression of doing homework rather than playing a game

never have i ever felt so helplessly addicted to being stuck managing a city in a winter apocalypse  never have i ever sat on my chair on a hot summers day and wanted to be thrown into that frozen wasteland  never have i ever understood politics but now i want to do all those things  and run for president

do you want a stressful city builder and a boring survival game while taking forever to make progress this is that game aesthetically mechanically graphically this game is great and the music is just as good as the original but the game play is just boring and there is no reason to care for the people go buy frostpunk its actually fun

frostpunk 2 was an incredible experience from start to finish the atmosphere was just as bleak and intense as the first game but the added layers of political tension and social conflict took it to another level i really enjoyed the challenge of balancing survival with longterm planning and the choices felt heavy and meaningful the story kept me hooked and the ending hit hard definitely worth playing if you liked the first one or enjoy deep morally complex strategy games
love the game and its an awesome sequel to the first game  also captains authority is a no brainer

the game is alright its pretty pricey for what it offers it is by no means a bad game the story events actually had me stress out here and there but once you explored everything it was rather easy pick it up on a good discount  technically the game has replayability but i dont think i will return to it
great and tense game

every savegame i create crashes the game how can you even play a game like that its no fun at all update after posting my review the developers contacted me asking me to send them my savegames for analysis they identified that heat auto allocate was responsible for the game freezing  i started a new game and so far after 20 hours of play i havent had any issues please fix the issue by using this option

a fantastic sequel for a fantastic game frostpunk 2 lives up to my expectations and often exceeds them  my biggest complaint is the main storys endgame i was so ready for it the last 2 chapters were over in a span of roughly 30 minutes to an hour i gained complete dictatorial authority with zero problems it seemed a bit too easy i played on the default difficulty  still i highly recommend it
i played for 7hrs in one sitting

frostpunk 2 just lacks the sauce from frostpunk 1 if you want to play on officer difficulty or above youre going to have to watch a guide for the early game or try and fail to learn a very specific pattern for how to grow in endless mode the story does not hit the same a second time i guess it feels like youre walking a thin line but not in a good narrative way but juggling mechanics to get to where youll always end up idk just doesnt hit the same as fp1

a suitable expansion on the original game it plays more like a resource management and politics simulator with minor elements of a postapocalyptic city builder in the background where the first game nearly exclusively focused on the survival and city building components of the game the second game mostly focuses on these new components i think this was a good move
played the first frostpunk and got hooked instantly second game is just as good

11 bit studios really was ambitious in this sequel i can see why fp1 player might dislike this one it is such a steep learning curve jumping into to fp2 even if youve played fp1 and that could feel discouraging as you play the first hour of the game that being said i really enjoyed this sequel the new mechanics and districtfaction building is refreshing
keep in mind this is a compltely different playstyle from frostpunk 1 here you focus more on an entire civilization which includes outposts and encampments rather than just 1 city

i would call it good enough  its different from frostpunk 1 in terms of overall scope of the deal since frostpunk 1 was about just 1 tile whereas frostpunk 2 introduces us to a much bigger scope of things and with some flexibility  this is a difficult game itself but it still brings lots of joy after youre able to understand ideas behind it

i was a bit hesitant at first due to the mixed reviews but once i tried it by myself its great the gameplay has changed a lot compared to the first frostpunk but its still a resource management and decisionmaking game at core what i like the most about it though is that building your city with districts is a lot more expansive and doesnt have such a strict time limit as all of the previous frostpunks scenarios had

just finished my first playthrough of the campaign i was just as enraptured by the story and game mechanics as the first frostpunk despite them being quite different not sure it will have the same replayability as the first game but my time and money was well spent on this one even if i only play this once
